metadata.title: CVE-2015-7837 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: The Linux kernel, as used in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, kernel-rt, andEnterprise MRG 2 and when booted with UEFI Secure Boot enabled, allowslocal users to bypass intended securelevel/secureboot restrictions byleveraging improper handling of secure_boot flag across kexec reboot.

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-aws package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gke package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-kvm package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure-fde package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.

linux-ibm package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-nvidia package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oracle package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-realtime: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by Ubuntu Pro ppa version').
linux-xilinx-zynqmp package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
